items.title: Escapee describes summary killings after Darfur city's fall
items.summary: (Reuters) -Sudanese paramilitary forces beat and shot men fleeing from a long-besieged city in Darfur after capturing it, according to an account from an escapee corroborated by statements from aid officials, satellite images, and unverified social media videos. Read full story

We deliver loads of exclusive deal opportunities in partnership with the brand so our readers can save a ton on its leathercraft goods, but this week you have a chance to score a bunch of it for FREE – we are giving away three $175 Burton Goods gift cards to some lucky winners.

items.title: Bluetti offers up to 47% exclusive Halloween savings on its Apex 300 series starting from new $1,349 low
items.summary:
As part of its newly launched Halloween Sale, and running parallel to the ongoing exclusive Pioneer Na(Sodium) power station launch savings, we are seeing lower-than-ever pricing on the brand’s Apex 300 Versatile Power Station and its bundles. Prices start from $1,349.10 shipped for the power station alone, after using the exclusive code 9TO5TOYS10F at checkout (and which only works for this series). It’s been carrying a $2,399 MSRP since releasing in May, though we’ve regularly had exclusive deals for our readers that take significantly more off the tag. We spotted this station previously dropping down the lowest three weeks ago during Prime Day, when it hit $1,394, but that rate is beaten out here by $45, giving you a total $1,050 savings at the best price we have tracked. Head below for more on this station and the full lineup of exclusive deals for the series.

items.summary: Razer is announcing a new Huntsman V3 Pro 8kHz keyboard for esports-level competition and speed-obsessed PC gamers. items.title: Apple and Microsoft are now both worth more than $4T
items.summary: This is the first time Apple's market capitalization has crossed the $4 trillion mark, making it the third company to ever cross the milestone after Nvidia and Microsoft.

items.title: Apple crosses a $4T market cap in intra-day trading, making it only the third public company ever to reach the milestone; AAPL is up 56% since its April low (Subrat Patnaik/Bloomberg)
items.summary:
Subrat Patnaik / Bloomberg:
Apple crosses a $4T market cap in intra-day trading, making it only the third public company ever to reach the milestone; AAPL is up 56% since its April low  —  Apple Inc. shares rose as much 0.4% to hit $4 trillion in market value, making the iPhone maker only the third public company in history to reach the milestone.

items.summary:

items.title: Your wrist will thank you for scoring Logitech’s Lift Vertical Wireless mouse down at just $50 today (All-time low)
items.summary:
Amazon is currently offering Logitech’s Lift Wireless Vertical Mouse for $49.99 shipped. This is originally a $70 mouse that’s been fetching $80 since a price hike earlier this year in May. Today’s deal knocks $30 off its usual going rate, landing it $7 below its previous all-time low and our mention before it saw a price hike earlier this year. This is the lowest we have seen this ergonomic mouse fetch to date, and both Graphite and Off-White variants are down to the $50 low today. Head below for more details.

This year we are already getting official confirmation from many of the biggest retailers and brands on when you can expect the Black Friday and Thanksgiving deals to begin and it looks like we are going to be getting a full month worth of big-time discounts in 2025. Deals are actually kicking off on October 31 this year and carrying right through to Thanksgiving 2025 and Black Friday with various sale events throughout the month of November.

items.title: VIOFO’s new A229 Ultra two and three-channel dash cams with first savings + FREE 256GB microSD starting from $340
items.summary:
Through the official VIOFO Amazon storefront, you can now pick up the brand’s latest A229 Ultra two and three-channel dash cams with their very first savings. You can score the VIOFO A229 Ultra Dual-Channel 4K Dash Cam at $339.99 shipped, after clipping the on-page coupon, while the VIOFO A229 Ultra Three-Channel 4K Dash Cam drops to $369.99 shipped, after clipping its on-page coupon. What’s more, both systems come with the added perk of getting a FREE 256GB microSD card too ($50 value)! You’d normally be spending $390 or $440 for these models at full price, with this being the first cash savings we’ve spotted since they released at the top of August. All-in-all, you’re getting $50 and $70 price cuts here, along with the FREE $50 microSD card, which sets the bar for future discounts down the road, officially putting its time keeping to its MSRP in the rearview mirror.

more…
